EmailTemplate.subject: Webinars: Spring Framework 5.0 & Full Stack Reactive NoSQL: Spring Data and Couchbase
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
june 6, 2017 <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars]]> New in Spring Framework 5.0: Functional Web Framework arjen poutsma, Pivotal june 14, 2017 9:00am pdt / 12:00pm EDT
In Spring Framework 5.0, we introduced a new, functional web framework, next to the existing annotation-driven programming model. In this talk, we will discuss this new framework: how it is used, what its goals are, how it compares to the annotation model, and other related topics.
Attend <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/jun-14-new-in-spring-framework-5-0-functional-web-framework-webinar?utm_source=pivotal-digest-s&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-framework-5.0_q217]]>
Full Stack Reactive NoSQL: Spring Data and Couchbase matt ingenthron, couchbase & Subhashni Balakrishnan, Couchbase july 13, 2017 11:00am pdt / 2:00pm EDT
In this session we will first review the capabilities of Spring Data Couchbase showing how the implementation makes it easy to leverage a reactive core for your apps. Then we will demonstrate how you can directly work with Couchbase's reactive interface in apps built on Spring Framework 4.0 to give you a sense of how Couchbase will go even further with Spring Framework 5.0's reactive interfaces.
Attend <[[https://content.pivotal.io/webinars/jul-13-full-stack-reactive-nosql-spring-data-and-couchbase-webinar?utm_source=pivotal-digest-s&utm_medium=email-link&utm_campaign=spring-couchbase_q217]]>
